original_data.question: A 24-year-old woman delivers a baby at term. The Apgar counts are 9 and 10 at 1 and 5 minutes, respectively. Thirty minutes after delivery, the mother’s blood pressure drops to 80/60 mm Hg and her pulse is 124/min. On physical examination, her distal extremities are clammy and cold, and the uterus is boggy. Aggressive fluid resuscitation is initiated. After administering 4 units of IV fluids and 4 units of whole blood, her vitals stabilize. The next morning, she says she is unable to lactate when she tries to breastfeed her child. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the failure of lactation in this patient?

model_response:
This patient has Sheehan syndrome. During delivery, the mother can develop a severe form of necrosis of the pituitary gland, which can lead to failure of lactation. The other choices are not related to the pituitary gland.

Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human females as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
A child between 1 and 23 months of age.
Birth at greater than or equal to 37 weeks using best estimated due date.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
Delivery of the FETUS and PLACENTA under the care of an obstetrician or a health worker. Obstetric deliveries may involve physical, psychological, medical, or surgical interventions.
Female parents, human or animal.

Abnormally low BLOOD PRESSURE that can result in inadequate blood flow to the brain and other vital organs. Common symptom is DIZZINESS but greater negative impacts on the body occur when there is prolonged depravation of oxygen and nutrients.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
The rhythmical expansion and contraction of an ARTERY produced by waves of pressure caused by the ejection of BLOOD from the left ventricle of the HEART as it contracts.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
The farthest or outermost projections of the body, such as the HAND and FOOT.
Having less heat energy than the object against which it is compared; the absence of heat.

The hollow thick-walled muscular organ in the female PELVIS. It consists of the fundus which is the site of EMBRYO IMPLANTATION and FETAL DEVELOPMENT. Beyond the isthmus at the perineal end of fundus, is CERVIX UTERI (the neck) opening into VAGINA. Beyond the isthmi at the upper abdominal end of fundus, are the FALLOPIAN TUBES.
Behavior which may be manifested by destructive and attacking action which is verbal or physical, by covert attitudes of hostility or by obstructionism.
The restoration to life or consciousness of one apparently dead. (Dorland, 27th ed)
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.
A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.
Condition did not change and required not further care to maintain condition
The time period between dawn and noon.
Salts or esters of LACTIC ACID containing the general formula CH3CHOHCOOR.
The nursing of an infant at the breast.
A person 6 to 12 years of age. An individual 2 to 5 years old is CHILD, PRESCHOOL.
The nursing of an infant at the breast.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
